Liga 1: Gubernur Kalteng Lempar Botol, Menpora Lepas Tangan
05 Nov 2019, 02:43 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga, Zainudin Amali menyerahkan insiden pelemparan botol oleh Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah, Sugianto Sabran, di Liga 1 Indonesia ke Kementerian Dalam Negeri. Ia enggan terlibat terlalu jauh karena wewenang tersebut ada di Kementerian Dalam Negeri.
"(Langkah) Mendagri sudah tepat, sudah melakukan komunikasi," kata Zainudin di Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Kepala Pusat Penerangan Kementerian Dalam Negeri Bahtiar, sebelumnya mengatakan, kementerian sudah turun tangan menyelesaikan persoalan Sugianto Sabran. Ia menyebut Kemendagri segera menyelesaikan masalah begitu insiden terjadi.
Terbukti, kata dia, Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah kini sudah meminta maaf kepada Kapolres Palangka Raya setelah insiden. Sehingga, masalahnya kini sudah selesai.
Upaya penyelesaian itu, lanjut Bahtiar, bukan dalam bentuk teguran secara terbuka dan tertulis. Sebab, menurut dia, teguran tidak akan menyelesaikan masalah namun malah akan memperlebar persoalan. “Senyap saja, yang penting masalah selesai demi ketenteraman warga masyarakat kita,” ucap dia.
Sebelumnya, Sugianto melempar botol saat menyaksikan laga Kalteng Putra melawan Persib Bandung, pada Jumat, 1 November 2019. Ia tidak terima saat pemain Kalteng Putra menerima kartu merah dari wasit. Aksi pelemparan itu langsung viral di media sosial. Kemudian dia menjadi bulan-bulanan netizen.
Sugianto yang terekam kamera terlihat melempar botol air mineral ke arah lapangan. Ia juga terlihat marah-marah sambil menunjuk-nunjuk sebelum turun dari tribun VVIP ke pinggir lapangan. Sugianto lantas menghampiri Kapolres Palangka Raya AKBP Timbul Siregar dan memarahinya.
Di laga itu Kalteng Putra kalah dari Persib 0-2. Di Liga 1 Indonesia, Kalteng Putra tengah berjuang keluar dari zona degradasi.

League 1: Central Kalimantan Governor Throws Bottles, Menpora Hands Off
05 Nov 2019, 02:43 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Youth and Sports, Zainudin Amali submitted the bottle-throwing incident by the Governor of Central Kalimantan, Sugianto Sabran, in League 1 of Indonesia to the Ministry of Home Affairs. He was reluctant to get too involved because the authority was in the Ministry of the Interior.
"The Ministry of Home Affairs (Ministry) has been right, has made communication," said Zainudin in Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Head of the Ministry of Interior's Information Center Bahtiar, previously said, the ministry had intervened to solve the Sugianto Sabran problem. He said the Ministry of Home Affairs immediately resolved the problem as soon as the incident occurred.
Evidently, he said, the Governor of Central Kalimantan has now apologized to the Palangkaraya Police Chief after the incident. So, the problem is now over.
The settlement effort, continued Bahtiar, was not in the form of open and written reprimands. Because, according to him, reprimands will not solve the problem but instead will widen the problem. "Just keep quiet, as long as the problem is solved for the sake of the peace of our citizens," he said.
Previously, Sugianto threw a bottle while watching the Kalteng Putra match against Persib Bandung, on Friday, November 1, 2019. He did not receive it when the Kalteng Putra player received a red card from the referee. The throwing action was immediately viral on social media. Then he became a netizen.
Sugianto recorded by the camera was seen throwing bottles of mineral water toward the field. He also looked angry while pointing before descending from the VVIP stands to the sidelines. Sugianto then approached the Palangkaraya Police Chief AKBP Timbul Siregar and scolded him.
In the match Kalteng Putra lost to Persib 0-2. In League 1 Indonesia, Kalteng Putra is struggling out of the relegation zone.

IRSYAN HASYIM
